Description: Rim, neck and shoulder sherd of Chian two-handled pottery jar, with right end of horizontal reflex handle; white slip; interior: reserved; on top of rim, two groups of short strokes; on outer edge of rim, chequer band; on neck, vertical tongue pattern alternating black and white; below on shoulder, part of handle with traces of vertical bars.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1924,1201.180 and 1924,1201.181. For parallels regarding the shape, see Lemos no. 1641 from Rizari and no. 1647 from Olbia.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2159) (phase 2)
